intro: Sphinga platyloba, commonly known as the flat-lobed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Its leaves are flat and grass-like, with a distinctive flat or slightly folded appearance. Sphinga platyloba produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
